articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Command of KPA Large Combined Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Command of KPA Large Combined Unit 671
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, state and army of the DPRK, inspected the Command of Large Combined Unit 671 of the KPA. 
					He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk and Kim Won Hong and KPA Lieut. General Ri Tu Song.
					
					After receiving a salute, Kim Jong Un waved back to the enthusiastically cheering service personnel before having a photo taken with them.
					
					He went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room devoted to the history of the unit.
					
					Seeing the precious mementoes and data associated with the efforts and wisdom and energy devoted by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, he looked back with deep emotion on the course of development covered by the unit along the road of victory and glory.
					
					He said earnestly that the history of the unit which has grown to be invincible and matchless ranks is a proud course shining with the undying leadership feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the development of the KPA.
					
					It is good for the large combined unit to conduct an effective education through the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room devoted to the history of the unit, he said. He gave the precious instructions which would serve as guidelines for doing an educational work through revolutionary relics.
					
					After acquainting himself with the performance of the unit's duty, he went round military lecture rooms to learn about the training of commanding officers and staff members.
					
					He noted with appreciation that the unit has conducted intensive training under the simulated conditions of an actual battle, thereby preparing all the commanding officers, staff members and servicepersons as a-match-for-a hundred combatants and defying-corps for national reunification capable of independently and positively performing their duties.
					
					Then he went round a company under the large combined unit.
					
					Watching with keen attention the training of service personnel at the training room, he encouraged them in undergoing training in an atmosphere of an actual battle true to the WPK's training-first policy.
					
					At a bedroom, he took its temperature with the help of a thermometer. Taking blankets for soldiers, he learned about their quality and was satisfied to hear that all of them liked warm and soft blankets.
					
					Looking at the steam rising from the water tank at the wash-cum-bath house, he asked about how water is kept warm. He told the company commander and political instructor to cooperate with each other and take good care of the living of the soldiers.
					
					Upon hearing that a lot of time has passed, he said that the time he spent among soldiers was the most worthwhile and he never considered it as a pity to spend time in such a manner. Then he made the rounds of supply service facilities including mess hall and soybean store.
					
					Noting that his visit to the command helped him to learn that everything including the command and management of the unit was going well, he stressed the need to further improve the command and management of the unit and establish steel-like military discipline through the concerted efforts of the commanding officers and soldiers and thus fully demonstrate the militant spirit and appearance as the most elite revolutionary forces.
					
					He expressed his expectation and belief that the servicepersons of the large combined unit would display the heroic mettle in the sacred service to defend the country before leaving for the next leg of his inspection tour.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Merited Persons
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Merited Persons
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent birthday spreads to Kim Il Sung Prize winner and People's Artiste Ri Jin Su who is advisory conductor of the Phibada Opera Troupe on his 80th birthday, Kim Il Sung Prize winner and People's Artiste Kim Yun who is artist of the Troupe and People's Artiste Son Jong Gwon who is director of the Korean April 26 Children's Film Studio, on their 70th birthdays.
					Ri emerged skillful conductor under the care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. He conducted a lot of works including a revolutionary opera "The Flower Girl", music and dance tale "Song of Paradise", grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" and "Ever-victorious Workers' Party of Korea".
					
					Kim has worked at the Phibada Opera Troupe for dozens of years. He contributed to the creation of operas and development of the Juche-oriented arts by creating stage decor for works including revolutionary operas "The Sea of Blood", "Tell O Forest" and "Song of Mt. Kumgang" in peculiar formative arts.
					
					Son also created many children's films popular among school youth and children and other Koreans including children's film "The Hedgehog Beats the Tiger" adapted from the tale told Kim Jong Il and serials of "The Boy General".
					
					The President and Kim Jong Il invited them to attend major meetings and conferences, awarded high state commendations to them and repeatedly showed loving care for them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Gifts Conveyed to Figure Skaters
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Gifts Conveyed to Figure Skaters
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Figure skaters were presented with gifts carrying leader Kim Jong Il's loving care. 
					Kim Jong Il watched a demonstration performance given by figure skaters last December, the last month of his great life, and gave important instructions to develop the Korean-style figure skating skills to demonstrate the honor of Juche Korea in international matches. 
					
					He promised to send the best skates to them, saying they should have good skates in order to develop the figure skating.  
					
					The dear respected Kim Jong Un made sure that the best figure skates were secured and sent to the skaters as gifts in the name of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					A meeting for conveying the gifts was held on Saturday.
					
					Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and officials in the field of sports, figure skaters and coaches. 
					
					Choe Ryong Hae made a speech at the meeting. 
					
					The speakers said Kim Jong Il is the tender-hearted father who showed such parental loving care to realize their hope to use good skates. 
					
					The sportspersons will strikingly demonstrate the might of Songun Korea with gold medals and thus live up to the deep trust of the peerlessly great men, they stressed.

articles.title: Vol. 15 of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Published
articles.content:
Vol. 15 of 'Selected Works of Kim Jong Il' Published
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 15 of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il"(enlarged edition).
					The book contains eight works including talks and letters leader Kim Jong Il made public in the period from June to October 1991.
					
					Expounded in those works are ideas and theories on victoriously advancing the revolutionary cause of Juche and further glorifying the Korean socialist system centered on the popular masses and ways to do so.
					
					The work "Young Men and Women, Be the Vanguard Unfailingly Loyal to the Party and the Leader" gives perfect exposition of the problems needed for the young people to creditably discharge their noble mission and duty on behalf of the times and the revolution.
					
					Among them are also works that set forth the tasks for developing the nation's science and technology on a higher stage and that expound the theoretical and practical problems arising in training party officials and state economic officials to meet the requirements of the developing reality.
					
					The work "Theory of Fine Art" deals with the essence of beauty, character of the Juche fine art, theory on fine art depiction, method of creating fine art works, etc.
					
					The work "Theory of Musical Art" clarifies such theoretical and practical problems as the nature of Juche music, its mission and role, content and form, performance and training of reserves and the tasks and ways to carry them into practice.
					
					In his work "Writers Should Be Ones of the Party and the Revolution Advancing with Revolutionary Pens Taken Up in Their Hands" Kim Jong Il urged the writers to share the destiny with the WPK, cherishing the trust of it which put forward them as its eternal companion, faithful helper and good adviser.
					
					There is also a work that advances the tasks for intensifying the land development drive to turn the mountains and streams of the country into more beautiful and better ones and spruce up scenic spots, parks and pleasure grounds to the features of socialism and improving the management of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.

articles.title: Guidelines for Juche-oriented Literature
articles.content:
Guidelines for Juche-oriented Literature
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The famous work "On Juche Literature" published by leader Kim Jong Il on January 20, Juche 81 (1992) has served as guidelines for a rapid development of Juche-oriented literature.
					The work expounds in a profound way theories on the times, literature and arts, national literary and art heritages, traditions of revolutionary literature and arts and portrayal of the leader in literary and art works.
					
					It also comprehensively clarifies the issues concerning principles of seed and depiction of works, genres and forms of literature and literary creation.
					
					The validity and vitality of the theories have been fully proved through many literary and art works created over the past two decades.
					
					Some 40 works portraying President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk were created as masterpieces. Among them are "Ode to the Sun", "Pyongyang Declares", "Prelude to Spring" and "Song of Women".
					
					The epic "Our Eternal Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung", revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Jong Il", lyrics "February is Spring", poem "Party is Mother" and many other works eulogize the leader and the Workers' Party and represent the Korean people's effort for the prosperity of the country.
					
					Some 3 000 novels were created on the basis of stirring events in Korea and the beautiful life of working people. Typical of them are "Delight", "Mt. Paekgum", "Ardent Wish", "Sea Route", "Wild Rose", "Pyongyang at Night" and "Fifteenth Year".
					
					Besides, dramas "We Will Recollect Today" and "Wish" and scenarios "A White Gem" and "A Day of Training" encourage the Korean army and people to continue vigorously advancing under the banner of Songun (military-first) politics.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Idea of Loving People Eulogized by Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Idea of Loving People Eulogized by Koreans in U.S.
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Koreans in U.S. held a meeting in New York after visiting the DPRK to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il , according to south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Minbo on Jan. 19.
					Speakers at the meeting said they saw for themselves compatriots in the north expressing deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, while staying in the homeland.
					
					The compatriots in the north felt so painful when recalling that Kim Jong Il demised on a train while making a high intensity forced march for field guidance, having uncomfortable sleep and taking rice balls, they said, adding such solemn atmosphere of mourning in the north could hardly be seen in any other parts of the world.
					
					They said they could clearly know that Kim Jong Il's idea of loving people resulted in forming a harmonious whole and achieving the single-minded unity in the north.
					
					They said they more keenly realized that Kim Jong Il performed immortal feats in carrying out the cause of Juche revolution, building a thriving nation and achieving the country's reunification and successfully settled the issue of inheriting the revolutionary cause.
					
					They said they were encouraged to see compatriots in the north renewing their pledge to turn out in the building of a thriving nation by converting their great sorrow into thousand-fold strength and courage.
					
					They stressed that they were struck with admiration at the meticulous care shown by Kim Jong Un, the new leader of the north, for overseas compatriots during the mourning period.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Lee Group to Stop Talking Nonsense
articles.content:
KCNA Urges Lee Group to Stop Talking Nonsense
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is now more noisily trumpeting about "dialogue" after rubbing salt into the wounds of fellow countrymen in the DPRK grieving over the great loss.
					It is asserting that it would "make efforts to mend the fences with the north", talking about "door to an opportunity" and "removal of mutual mistrust." 
					
					It is highly ridiculous and shameless for the most hideous group of traitors to still vociferate about "dialogue" even after it received the DPRK's solemn declaration of no longer dealing with it.
					
					How can the attitude the group took during the mourning over the great loss to the nation when even the sky and the land seemed to wail be interpreted as a simple ethical issue or a mistake of policy.
					
					The group must be well aware that the DPRK has not made any concession nor shown any mercy over the issue related to the dignity of its supreme leadership.
					
					The DPRK has never pardoned the Kim Young Sam's group of traitors for treachery it committed during the mourning over the passing of President Kim Il Sung and it will remain unchanged in its strong counter-action against the treachery. 
					
					This being a hard reality, the Lee group is brazen-faced enough to call for "dialogue" far from making even a single apology for its high treason. 
					
					This is touching off irrepressible resentment among the Korean people. 
					
					The DPRK will never regard the confrontation maniacs as a dialogue partner as they are groundlessly hurting the dignity of the DPRK and  its system and insulting and slandering its people, denying the DPRK's reality in which the army and people are stepping up their general advance full of conviction with redoubled efforts by converting their sorrow into strength and courage.
					
					It is foolish and preposterous for the group to try to calm down the resentment of all Koreans and divert elsewhere the south Koreans' attention on the point of eruption with the nonsensical story about "dialogue".
					
					Its hypocritical wordplay is only triggering bitterer anger among compatriots. 
					
					The foe of the nation would be well advised to stop talking nonsense at once.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts Smear Campaign of S. Korean Puppet Group
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts Smear Campaign of S. Korean Puppet Group
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group is running the whole gamut of artifices to hurt the DPRK grieving the great loss to the nation.
					Yesterday Daily NK being operated by human scum released misinformation cooked up in a back room of Chongwadae and KBS echoed it.
					
					Today CBS and other media released false reports about the DPRK, talking about "discovery of leaflets".
					
					Even authorities joined this smear campaign, trumpeting about the DPRK's "unstable system" everyday.
					
					This campaign is peppered with lies and deception. 
					
					The puppet group's despicable attitude stunned not only media at home but the world, touching off derision and criticism.
					
					Many media at home and abroad including Huan Qiu Shibao of China and Hangyore of south Korea accused mass media in Seoul of intensifying the smear campaign against the DPRK, noisily trumpeting about various pieces of misinformation through their local news coverage teams. They cited facts to prove it.  
					
					Lurking behind the anti-DPRK smear campaign stepped up by the group on the basis of lies about what happened after the big loss though it turned out to be hypocrisy overnight is a sinister aim which should not be overlooked. 
					
					It is the intention of the group of traitors to incite the hostile forces' aggression and interference in the DPRK and gratify its ambition for "regime change" at any cost by creating impression that the DPRK is instable and complicated within.
					
					The group judges that doing so is favorable for it to divert elsewhere the public opinion on rapidly changed situation in south Korea, caused by the status of the ruling "Grand National Party" on the point of collapse, etc. and prolong its remaining days by tiding over the crisis.
					
					The ongoing smear campaign was prompted by the group's consciousness of the crisis created inside and outside and its impatience from the failure in its "policy toward the north."
					
					However, such petty trick of traitor Lee Myung Bak has short wings in the bright world.
					
					The Lee group will be bound to face stern punishment by history for its unpardonable treacherous and unpopular rule and evil doings.
					
					The more desperately they may try, the earlier their fate will be precipitated.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists Can Never Evade Responsibility for Their Monstrous Crime: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists Can Never Evade Responsibility for Their Monstrous Crime: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists' poisoning of Kojong, the 26th King of the Feudal Government of the Ri Dynasty on Jan. 20, 1919 was the thrice-cursed crime committed by them against the Korean people, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined article.
					It goes on:
					
					The Japanese imperialists annexed Korea after cooking up the murder of Minbi, queen of Kojong, hatched a plot to finish off Kojong in a bid to cover up their aggression.
					
					They regarded Kojong as a thorn in their flesh as he stubbornly opposed the conclusion of the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" from its outset. They hatched a sinister plot to eliminate him. 
					
					As he failed to see through the true nature of the U.S. and British imperialists who instigated and helped the Japanese imperialists in their operation to invade Korea behind scene, Kojong dispatched a secret envoy to the International Peace Conference in June 1907, prompted by his desire to preserve the country's independence with their help.  
					
					The Japanese imperialists repeatedly hatched all sorts of plots to eliminate Kojong from the political arena and succeeded in dethroning him by shifting the blame for the "Hague incident of secret emissary" on Kojong. Not content with this, they went the lengths of poising him in the end. 
					
					Details of poisoning Kojong are mentioned in the "Second Declaration of Independence" drafted and published by the provisional government in Shanghai, China in 1921 and a personal message of King Uichin, Kojong's child by a concubine.
					
					It is written there that a lot of red spots were seen on the whole body of Kojong right after his death and when Min Yong Gi and Hong Kung Sop discovered a lot of decomposition along with red spots on his whole body during the examination of his body before claiming he was poisoned, the Japanese imperialists arrested them.
					
					Facts go to eloquently prove that Kojong was cruelly poisoned by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					The suppression of the head of state is the most vivid expression of state-sponsored terrorism.
					
					Absolutely unpardonable is the above-said crime committed by the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: No Force Can Ever Block DPRK's Advance: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No Force Can Ever Block DPRK's Advance: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- No force can ever bar the DPRK from advancing along the road of socialism no matter how rapidly the international situation may change and no matter how desperately the imperialists may work.
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The socialist system in the DPRK remains undeterred and stands firm though its army and people lost the father of the nation again so suddenly and early, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					It is the reality of the DPRK where collectivism is displayed at the highest level because the leader regards the people as Heaven, the party sincerely serves the people and they do everything according to the leader's will and intention, firmly armed with his idea. 
					
					Deeply enshrined in the hearts of the service personnel and people of the DPRK is the faith that their leader, party and system are the best.
					
					The DPRK grew stronger, not waned, and became richer, not poorer in the unprecedentedly difficult days. Its prosperity is not something in the future but is becoming a reality.
					
					Foolish and pitiable, indeed, are the hostile forces waiting for something to happen in the DPRK, still failing to understand everything there.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK are not the same with weak and faithless army and people who abandon their boat at a loss in a rough sea under the influence of the tumultuous international politics before getting on a rescue ship of the imperialists to kick up a row and create complexity. No force on earth can block their advance as they are aware of the justice of their cause and inevitability of its triumph.
					
					History goes to prove that the advance of the DPRK for socialism is so dynamic that nothing can block it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Deserve Severest Punishment
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Deserve Severest Punishment
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities recently let the human scum who defected to south Korea malignantly slander the people in the DPRK stricken with bitter grief over the loss of the father of the nation. Not content with this, they cooked up cock-and-bull stories in a bid to build up public opinion. Their behavior comes under fire by bylined commentaries of newspapers Saturday.
					This is a heinous provocation to dare hurt the single-minded unity of the people closely united behind the party and the leader and tarnish the image of the dignified system in the DPRK, they note.
					
					Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					The tears shed by the people of the DPRK during the mourning period represent the sincerest fidelity as they have followed and respected the leader as their father. This was an expression of the most profound grief which could be found only in the society of the DPRK where the leader and all the service personnel and people formed a harmonious whole.
					
					The south Korean authorities and human scum viewed the sadness of the people of the DPRK at the loss of their real father, their sun, with jaundiced eyes. This was an unethical behavior of those who had already been deprived of humanity.
					
					One, however, knows too well that the Lee Myung Bak group is despicable and narrow-minded political charlatans hell-bent on fraud, swindle, plots and deception. The people were simply stunned by the group which insulted the Korean people's sense of obligation and conscience with unspeakable jargons and twisted the reality by telling sheer lies which no one knows where it borrowed from.
					
					The Lee group deserves the severest punishment.
					
					Clear is its ulterior intention. In a word, it is aimed to shake the strong single-minded unity of the DPRK and realize its wild ambition steeped in confrontation of systems.
					
					This is, however, nothing but a daydream. The confidence and will of the people in the DPRK regarding the headquarters of the revolution as their own lives remain unchanged and the single-minded unity has grown stronger while experiencing the most arduous trial during the mourning. The revolutionary ranks of the DPRK are steadily advancing dynamically along the road of Songun under the leadership of the great Workers' Party of Korea, always holding in high esteem the sun of Juche. It is ridiculous, indeed, for such narrow-minded profiteers to try to hurt the DPRK.
					
					Minju Joson stresses that the army and people of the DPRK will force the Lee group of traitors to pay dearly for all the thrice-cursed crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Opposes U.S. Pressure
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Opposes U.S. Pressure
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea on Jan. 16 made public a commentary condemning the U.S. unjust pressure and interference under the pretence of alliance. 
					Referring to the fact that the U.S. has put pressure on south Korea to join in its anti-Iran sanctions under its domestic law, the commentary said this is little different from threat to impose sanctions on south Korea.
					
					If south Korea yields to the U.S. pressure, the economic sovereignty of south Korea will be seriously violated and, consequently, damage will be brought to its people, it said.
					
					Such unjust demand of the U.S. should never be accepted, the commentary said, adding that south Korea should get rid of the trap of alliance which brings only burdens and pains to the people.

articles.title: Suppression of Progressives Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Progressives Censured in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea made public a statement on Jan. 18 in denunciation of the authorities' repression of the progressive forces.
					At dawn of Wednesday the Intelligence Service, prosecution and police searched houses of four members of the Union including its chief vice-chairman. They conducted search operation for 12 hours in those houses of no person after breaking their doors and then confiscated computer components used in teaching schoolers.
					
					Recalling this fact, the statement said that such repression was made under accusation that they are violators of the "National Security Law" because they visited the DPRK for exchange and cooperation between teachers from the south and the north in 2003, conducted activities of support for the Solidarity for Progress and aided Korean schools in Japan.
					
					What the Union conducted in 2003 was done under the consent of the "government," it stressed.
					
					So there can be no reason to conduct search and confiscate private belongings by invoking the NSL, the statement said, urging the authorities to stop the suppression campaign aimed to put down the people's anti-"government" sentiment.
					
					It declared that the Union would intensify the struggle for peace and reunification of the south and the north of Korea in solidarity with political parties and civic and social organizations in face of the authorities' suppression campaign launched with the approach of the general elections.

articles.title: Authorities' Wrong Policy Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Wrong Policy Flailed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Members of the opposition United Progressive Party in south Korea took a demo at Seoul Railway Station on Wednesday to condemn the puppet authorities for serving the plutocrats in disregard of the popular masses' interests. 
					They charged that the Lee Myung Bak "government" is scheming to privatize the railway and transfer it to a big business under the pretext of deficit. 
					
					This is a foolish "policy" as it will add interests to the one percent plutocrats with taxes from the population and seriously disturb public order, they said.
					
					Such scheme of the present chief executive can never be tolerated, they said, declaring that they would make every possible effort to check privatization of the railway.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea to Stage Anti-DPRK War Games
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea to Stage Anti-DPRK War Games
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggression forces and the south Korean Marine Corps are scheming to stage in a big way anti-DPRK joint military exercises, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					The commanders of the U.S. marines present in south Korea and the south Korean marines met at the command of the U.S. marines in Ryongsan, Seoul on Jan. 19 to discuss the large-scale joint landing exercises dubbed "Ssangryong" to be staged in and around Phohang, North Kyongsang Province, in March.
					
					The trigger-happy forces plan to conduct such drills for preemptive attack as landing, infiltration and live firing with involvement of as many as ten thousand troops belonging to the U.S. Third Marine Expedition stationed in Okinawa of Japan as well as the marines during the exercises, which will be reportedly the biggest ever after the "Team Spirit" joint military exercises in 1989.
					
					The two marines have also agreed to stage on the five islands in the West Sea of Korea field mobile rehearsal focusing on the discussion of tactics, topographical scouting and enlarged naval firing drills in the first half of this year, apart from the said exercises, and to make this rehearsal annual one from this year.
					
					In the meantime, the south Korean war hawks decided to dispatch troops of its marine corps to war games that will be conducted overseas in February and July under the supervision of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces.
					
					Though frequently calling for dialogue, the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers can never cover up their wild design to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.

articles.title: S. Korea's Conservative Media Flailed for Anti-DPRK Campaign
articles.content:
S. Korea's Conservative Media Flailed for Anti-DPRK Campaign
Pyongyang. January 21 (KCNA) -- Some media organs of south Korea are now dancing to the tune of the Lee Myung Bak regime's anti-DPRK rhetoric. As regards the fact, KCNA had an interview with an officer of the Korean People's Army (KPA), Jang Il Guk, and Ri Pok Sun, a department director of the C.C., the Journalists Union of Korea. 
					Question: The ultra-rightist conservative media of south Korea, including KBS, Tong-A Ilbo and Chosun Ilbo, are misrepresenting the situation of the DPRK and even slandering its supreme leadership. How do you think about this?
					
					Jang Il Guk: KBS is misleading public opinion in favor of the south Korean regime, but nobody will be deceived by its misinformation. 
					
					Our servicepersons, with defending the headquarters of the revolution as their main mission, are determined to smash KBS taking the lead in the anti-DPRK campaign.
					
					Anyone who dares slander the supreme leadership of the DPRK will be a target of our revolutionary forces, wherever they are.
					
					If their ceaseless provocations lead to a war, what the DPRK will achieve is national reunification and what it will lose is the Military Demarcation Line dividing the country into two parts.
					
					Ri Pok Sun: Objectivity and impartiality are vital to media activities. But the conservative media of south Korea only fawn on the power. 
					
					It is shameful for them to ignore their mission and duty and serve the group of traitors denounced by the people.
					
					The media of the Korean nation are obliged to conduct patriotic activities encouraging all the Koreans to make efforts for the country's independent reunification.
					
					Doing treacherous acts, daunted by pressure, will lead to self-destruction.
					
					The conservative media of south Korea deserve nationwide condemnation for their hack activities going against the trend of the times and the aspiration of the nation and fanning confrontation between the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Media Ill-famed for Misinformation
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Media Ill-famed for Misinformation
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Conservative media of south Korea have come under criticism and derision by the public at home and abroad for their intensified slanders against the DPRK after it suffered the great loss to the nation. 
					Chinese paper Huan Qiu Shibao on Friday carried an article by its correspondent in south Korea, which said: 
					
					Media of south Korea are making much ado about various sorts of misinformation. Among them is a gossip that China will help build a nuclear power plant for the DPRK. 
					
					Choongang Ilbo on Thursday reported two pieces of news aimed at China. One is that China is making preparations to build a nuclear power plant in the Rason Economic Trade Zone of the DPRK. The other is that China may offer an aid of food amounting to hundreds of thousands of tons to keep stability in the DPRK. 
					
					Yonhap News on Thursday continued to slander the DPRK. It reported that the DPRK is now suffering from "shortage of power and drinking water" and the price of goods is "skyrocketing" there.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in France
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in France
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was brought out in pamphlet by the Democrate Publishing House under the Anti-Imperialist Front of France on his birth anniversary.
					The work, published on October 2, Juche 84 (1995), serves as a great programme for party building and activities as it reviews with pride the glorious history of the Workers' Party of Korea which paved a new path for building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicates a way of strengthening the WPK into the eternal party of the President.

articles.title: International Kim Il Sung Foundation Meets
articles.content:
International Kim Il Sung Foundation Meets
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The International Kim Il Sung Foundation at meetings of its council held in Hong Kong and Macao of China in October and December last year discussed issues of glorifying the immortal exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for the human cause of independence.
					The meetings decided to start donating money to the Foundation from January this year marking the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung and the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il reflecting boundless reverence of all Koreans and progressive mankind for the peerlessly great men.
					
					They also reviewed activities over the past four years since the establishment of the Foundation.
					
					Present there were Johnny Hon, chairman of the Foundation, its members and a delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Il Eulogized
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Il Eulogized
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Badalona City on Jan. 13 on the theme of "Let us commemorate the centenary of birth of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung significantly!" under the sponsorship of the Katalonia, Spain, Branch of the Korean Friendship Association.
					Present there were personages including the chairman of the association and the head of the Spain-Asia Chamber of Commerce.
					
					At the meeting the chairman read out the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK to be followed by speeches.
					
					The revolutionary life and the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung will shine forever with history, the chairman said, and went on:
					
					The DPRK has developed to be an invincible power under the Songun revolutionary leadership of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					His immortal exploits performed for the victory in the cause of socialism will remain forever in the hearts of mankind.
					
					The service personnel and people of the DPRK are united close around the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the Korean people have a rosy future as they are led by him.

articles.title: Guatemalan President on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Guatemalan President on Relations with DPRK
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- I express deep condolences on the demise of the great leader HE Kim Jong Il.
					Guatemalan President Otto Perez Molina told this to DPRK Ambassador to Guatemala An Kun Song, the representative of the DPRK government, at a reception given on his assumption of office on Jan. 14.
					
					Hoping that the Korean people would achieve great success in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the reunification of the country under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he stressed that he would make positive efforts to develop the bilateral relations in the future.

articles.title: DPRK under Kim Jong Un Introduced
articles.content:
DPRK under Kim Jong Un Introduced
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted special write-ups on the internet on January 13.
					The internet homepage of the international alliance posted photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un. It said in an article titled "The greatness of the nation depends on the greatness of the leader": 
					
					Kim Il Sung was an iron-willed commander who defeated two formidable imperialisms in one generation.
					
					He led the social revolution at two stages and the socialist construction of various phases to victories, building a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					Kim Jong Il led the Korean revolution in the same way as Kim Il Sung's.
					
					He developed the Workers' Party of Korea to be an invincible party and the Korean People's Army to be a matchless army with his extraordinary ideas, theories, deep insight, outstanding leadership art, extraordinary revolutionary sweep, iron will and matchless grit.
					
					The dear respected Kim Jong Un is standing at the helm of the Korean revolution.
					
					There are many countries in the world, but there is no such country as the DPRK which has advanced the revolution and construction without the slightest deviation under the guidance of the great leaders generation after generation. 
					
					The Korean people who hold Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the supreme leader of the party, army and people will certainly realize the desire of Kim Il Sung and the ideal of Kim Jong Il before long.
					
					The internet homepage of the Nigerian National Committee praised the immortal exploits Kim Jong Il performed in the struggle to defend socialism, build a thriving nation, and achieve national reunification and accomplish the human cause of independence.
					
					The homepage introduced in detail the outstanding personality of Kim Jong Un as a great man.

articles.title: Russia Opposes Military Attack on Iran: FM
articles.content:
Russia Opposes Military Attack on Iran: FM
Moscow, January 20 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minster Sergei Lavrov Wednesday in a press conference clarified the country's stand against any attempted military attack on Iran.
					Military attack on Iran is very dangerous in any case and it will not be "a brief stroll", he said, adding that such attack would cause chain reaction with its end invisible.

articles.title: EU Embargo on Iranian Oil, "Economic Suicide" for Europe: Iranian Official
articles.content:
EU Embargo on Iranian Oil, "Economic Suicide" for Europe: Iranian Official
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Iran's OPEC Governor Mohammad-Ali Khatibi said Tuesday that the potential European Union (EU) embargo on Iranian oil is "economic suicide" for Europe, the local satellite Press TV reported.
					"The U.S. and some European countries should avoid adventurism in the world's oil market," he said.

articles.title: India Rejects U.S. Think Tank Report on Nuclear Safety
articles.content:
India Rejects U.S. Think Tank Report on Nuclear Safety
New Delhi, January 20 (KCNA) -- Strongly rejecting the findings of a U.S.-based think tank which poorly rated India on nuclear safety index, New Delhi Tuesday said the findings were based on "faulty methodology" and it used "unreliable information".
					Foreign Secretary Ranjan Mathai said all nuclear materials in India were subject to strict oversight controls.

articles.title: Two Palestinians Killed by Israeli Bombing on Gaza
articles.content:
Two Palestinians Killed by Israeli Bombing on Gaza
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army continued to kill Palestinians despite protest and denunciation of the international community.
					A second Palestinian died Wednesday afternoon after he was critically wounded by an Israeli bombing in northeast Gaza Strip, medics said.
					
					A medical spokesperson in Gaza told earlier that the bombing killed a 23-year-old Palestinian and wounded two, one of them critically.

articles.title: What Koreans Overseas Witnessed during Mourning Period in Homeland
articles.content:
What Koreans Overseas Witnessed during Mourning Period in Homeland
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Jaju Minbo on Friday carried a travelogue written by Yu Thae Yong, chairman of the East American Regional Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration after visiting Pyongyang to mourn the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The travelogue titled "The land and the sky seemed to wail. It was true bitter tears that we saw in Pyongyang." 
					
					Chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il passed away on a train on Dec. 17 last year due to serious mental strain he got during his long journey for field guidance, said the travelogue.
					
					It recounted a story that despite his fatigue and bad health, Kim Jong Il visited South Hamgyong Province for field guidance and as soon as he came back from there on De.15, he set about on his journey to a place in the northern tip of the country for the same purpose.
					
					The travelogue quoted compatriots in the north as lamenting: "Kim Jong Il demised to our sorrow after undergoing sufferings without having a proper chance to put on a tie all his life." 
					
					It continued:
					
					In 1994 when President Kim Il Sung passed away, I witnessed the 
					
					"unforeseen mourning" in company with Yang Un Sik, chairman of the American Regional Committee of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification. 
					
					At that time, Kim Il Sung passed so suddenly that the homeland was not prepared at all and it had never experienced this before so that it looked like a mourning house in very unstable conditions. 
					
					To cap it all, the homeland was hit by consecutive years of natural disasters after the passing of the President. Consequently, it had to make the "Arduous March" for several years. 
					
					It was against the backdrop of this crisis that General Kim Jong Il displayed his ability as a leader of the people, leading the army and people to form a harmonious whole and work such dramatic historic miracle as building a nuclear power despite the outside forces' threats.   
					
					As these historic experiences are vivid in the memory, the compatriots in the north so bitterly wailed over the untimely passing of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					It was snowing heavily prior to the ceremony of biding last farewell to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					I thought the sky was so "heartless" when looking out of a window of Pyongyang Koryo Hotel.
					
					However, the Pyongyangites overcome with sorrow over the great loss did not care the heavy snow and the cold weather which registered 10 degrees below zero. 
					
					Concerned that snow might cover the roads to be passed by the car carrying the bier of the leader on Dec. 28, Pyongyangites, men and women, young and old, began covering them with quilts and blankets as one. They also used mufflers and coats.  
					
					Quite many Pyongyangites and people from local areas came out to remove snow and ice from roads. 
					
					I approached a woman and asked. "Why are you doing it?"
					
					Her answer was clear. "We do wish dear NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il safe passing." She said this in a choking voice with tears in her eyes. Seeing her, I was also moved to tears. 
					
					The north has held that the two leaders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il consistently embodied the idea of love for the motherland and people.
					
					Anyhow, nobody can deny the fact that through the mourning the north evidently showed before the world the wonderful and beautiful picture of the unity of the party, army and people.
					
					My condolatory visit gave me an opportunity to understand the real meaning of a Korean proverb which says "One might not visit a wedding house but never miss visiting the house in mourning".
					
					When watching many soldiers and people stand in a solemn atmosphere for about three hours at the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the funeral was held on Dec. 28, I was touched by its process and the perfect order that prevailed among the participants. 
					
					I came back after getting full understanding of the fact that Kim Jong Il had uncomfortable sleep and rice-balls during his field guidance, a story about which I had only heard, and a moving story about slogans such as "single-minded unity is more powerful than nuclear weapons" during my participation in the mourning events as one of the Korean residents in the U.S.
					
					The compatriots in the north grieved over the passing of Kim Jong Il, beating the ground, but were never disappointed and frustrated. 
					
					That's because they firmly believed that the dear respected Kim Jong Un would build a thriving nation and surely achieve the peaceful reunification of the country despite the imperialists' moves to swallow up the Korean nation.

articles.title: Indonesia Rejects West's Sanctions on Iran: FM
articles.content:
Indonesia Rejects West's Sanctions on Iran: FM
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Indonesian Foreign Minister Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa on Jan. 18 slashed at the West's sanctions on Iran's oil industry.
					He warned that the sanctions would cause a lot of perplexities and drive the world economy into serious upheaval.
					
					He stressed that Iran's nuclear issue should be settled through negotiations.

articles.title: Iran Demands Withdrawal of Foreign Forces from Region
articles.content:
Iran Demands Withdrawal of Foreign Forces from Region
Teheran, January 20 (KCNA) -- Mohsen Rezai, secretary of the State Well-Being Council of Iran, in a press interview on Jan. 18 demanded withdrawal of foreign forces from the region.
					He said that if the U.S. and UK are interested in the security of the region, it would be better for them to withdraw their forces from the region.
					
					Iran is able to defend the security in the Persian Gulf and Strait of Hormuz in cooperation with regional countries, without its dependence on outside forces, he added.

articles.title: Putin Concerned about U.S. Scheme for Deployment of MD
articles.content:
Putin Concerned about U.S. Scheme for Deployment of MD
Moscow, January 20 (KCNA) -- Vladimir Putin, prime minister of Russia, on Jan. 18 expressed concern about the U.S. attempt to deploy elements of the missile defense system along Russia's borders.
					Though repeatedly declaring that the MD in Europe, one of the most important issues between Russia and the U.S., is not aimed at Russia, the U.S. administration has refused to guarantee this in any written statement, Putin charged.
					
					In case elements of the MD are deployed in Russia's neighboring countries including Georgia, Russia's striking means are compelled to target these objects, he warned.

articles.title: ACNC comenta disparates de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
ACNC comenta disparates de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ACNC) -- En estos dias, la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak, que dio sablazo en el alma de sus connacionales entristecidos por el gran duelo nacional, habla de "dialogo" exponiendo la supuesta "oportunidad", "eliminacion de la desconfianza reciproca" y el "esfuerzo por solucionar las relaciones Sur-Norte".
					Es mas alta descarada y absurda la actitud de los traidores que no toman en consideracion la declaracion  de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de no sentarse con la infame banda traidora.
					
					?Como explicaran los traidores sus actos hechos en el periodo del gran duelo nacional por el deceso del Dirigente Kim Jong Il? ?Es esto carente de la etica o de la politica?
					
					Ellos sabran muy bien el que hasta la fecha, la RPDC no cedio ni un paso atras en cuanto al asunto relacionado con  la dignidad maxima.
					
					El pueblo coreano nunca tolero el acto traidor de Kim Young Sam cometido al fallecer el Presidente Kim Il Sung y otros tipejos y sera invariable el categorico enfrentamiento por el respecto aunque pasen mil anos.
					
					A pesar de esto, la banda traidora, sin pedir disculpa ante su gran crimen cometido esta vez habla descaradamente del "dialogo", lo que incita solo el odio incontenible.
					
					No seran nuestra contraparte del dialogo los fanaticos conflictivos que denigran sin fundamento la dignidad, el regimen y el pueblo de la RPDC dando espaldas a la realidad en que convirtiendo la tristeza en la fuerza y coraje, el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC aceleran la marcha general.
					
					El intento de calmar a traves del rumor del "dialogo" la colera de todos los coreanos y enganar la opinion publica de los habitantes surcoreanos, es totalmente absurdo y sueno irrealizable.
					
					Los disparates enganosos de la banda traidora de Lee solo provocan la mas indignacion de todos los coreanos.
					
					Los enemigos de la nacion deben poner de inmediato fin a sus mentiras.

articles.title: Periodicos vuelven a denunciar actos inmorales de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Periodicos vuelven a denunciar actos inmorales de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ACNC) -- Recientemente, las autoridades surcoreanas insultaron por conducto de los traidores a la patria las lagrimas derramadas por los habitantes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea por el fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y trataron de ventilar en la opinion publica un rumor intrigante inventado por si mismas.
					En sendos comentarios individuales difundidos este sabado, los periodicos capitalinos califican esa fechoria de grave provocacion encaminada a desvirtuar la unidad monolitica del pueblo coreano en torno a su partido y lider y a mellar la imagen del muy digno regimen de la RPDC.
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun senala que las lagrimas del pueblo coreano vertidas durante el gran duelo nacional son las mas puras, que parten de la fidelidad a su lider considerado como padre, y la expresion de pesar que se puede ver solo en la sociedad de Corea donde el Dirigente y todos los militares y civiles estan unidos de cuerpo y alma.
					
					Interpretar malintencionadamente la tristeza del pueblo coreano por la perdida de su lider, sol de la vida, es una accion inmoral de los que dejaron de ser humanos, precisa Rodong Sinmun y prosigue:
					
					Ya era conocido que la banda de Lee Myung Bak es integrada por los estafadores politicos habituados al fraude, embuste, complot y engano. 
					
					Pero, esta vez, sobrepasaron la imaginacion sus chismes y mentiras con que ofendieron la moral y la conciencia del pueblo coreano y distorsionaron la realidad. Con solo este hecho, ellos merecen el castigo de cielo.
					
					Ellos intentan lo que nunca va a suceder, o sea, socavar la unidad monolitica de la RPDC y realizar la anejada ambicion de enfrentar los regimenes del Norte y el Sur.
					
					La fe y la voluntad del pueblo coreano, que consideran la Direccion de la Revolucion como su vida, son invariables y la unidad monolitica se hizo mas solida durante el gran duelo nacional, periodo mas dificil para el.
					
					Es tan ridiculo que un punado de estafadores intentara meter cuna en las filas revolucionarias de la RPDC que avanzan por la senda del Songun bajo la direccion del partido enalteciendo siempre al Sol del Juche.
					
					El periodico Minju Joson subraya que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea ajustaran sin falta las cuentas de los crimenes de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak.

articles.title: EE.UU. y Sur de Corea planean practicar ejercicios anti-RPDC
articles.content:
EE.UU. y Sur de Corea planean practicar ejercicios anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ACNC) -- Segun la cadena surcoreana Yonhap News, las tropas agresivas norteamericanas y las fuerzas navales del ejercito surcoreano planean practicar un gran simulacro conjunto de caracter agresivo contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El comandante de las fuerzas navales norteamericanas estacionadas en el Sur de Corea y su par surcoreano se reunieron el dia 19 en la comandancia de las fuerzas navales norteamericanas situada en Ryongsan de Seul y manipularon el complot para librar en marzo en la zona de Phohang de la provincia de Kyongsang del Norte el simulacro conjunto de desembarco de gran envergadura llamado "Ssangryong".
					
					En estos ejercicios conjuntos, que se libraran en gran envergadura nunca vista tras el simulacro conjunto "Team Spirit" de 1989, se movilizaran, ademas de las fuerzas navales, mas de diez mil efectivos pertenecidos al ejercito de expedicion de fuerzas maritimas No.3 de EE.UU. estacionado en Okinawa de Japon para realizar el entrenamiento de ataque preventivo inclusive el desembarco, la infiltracion y el fuego de balas reales.
					
					Por separado de estos ejercicios, las unidades marinas norteamericanas y surcoreanas decidieron desplegar en el primer semestre de este ano en cinco islas del Mar Oeste de Corea el entrenamiento de movilizacion en el aire libre, cuyo contenido fundamental son la discusion de tacticas, la exploracion geologica y la ampliacion de los ejercicios de fuego maritimo y acordaron regularizarlo desde el ano en curso.
					
					Por otra parte, los belicistas surcoreanos decidieron enviar sus fuerzas maritimas a los simulacros belicos que se realizaran en febrero y julio en ultramar bajo el auspicio de las tropas agresivas norteamericanas.
					
					Aunque el imperio yanqui y los belicistas surcoreanos hablan tanto del "dialogo", no pueden encubrir su ambicion agresiva de aplastar a la RPDC con las fuerzas armadas.
